page.title: 15 Order Of St.John
page.content: After the closing of the hospital of St.John at Lt.Maplestead,the order of Knights Hospitallers disappeared, but in 1836 the Order of St.John of Jerusalem was refounded.Early this century the church of England gave the Round Church back to the Order.The Vicar,Rev. K.Belben,is Chaplain of the Order. He wears a tippet over his cassock lined in red, showing that originally Chaplains were cardinals. There is a St.John's cross embroidered on it. Mr. Felton,an elderly man who the class interviewed,is a serving brother of the Order. In the Middle Ages Serving Brothers looked after the Knights in the Chapel. On 16th June, 1985 there was the Annual St.John's service in the Round Church.The Order now has three functions-to teach first aid,to run the ambulance service and to run an eye hosital in Jerusalem.
